message.content:
The redundant data type in the given program is the `unsigned` data type. It has been typedef'd as `unsigned` but it's unnecessary since `unsigned` is already a valid data type in C.

To substitute every instance of the redundant data type with its associated original data type, we need to replace all occurrences of `unsigned` with `unsigned int` in the program.

Here is the modified program with the redundant data type replaced:

```json
{
  "program": "void fn1(unsigned int p1, int p2) { printf(\"checksum = %X\\n\", p1); }\n\
int fn2(int p1, int p2) { return p1; }\n\
short fn3(short p1, short p2) { return p1; }\n\
int fn4(int p1, int p2) { return p1 % p2; }\n\
unsigned int fn5(unsigned int p1, unsigned int p2) { return p1; }\n\
unsigned int s;\n\
unsigned int u;\n\
int v;\n\
static unsigned int w = 254U;\n\
int ad[7][5][7] = {{8}, {8}, {{8}, 0x98}};\n\
short ae;\n\
int af;\n\
int fn9() {\n\
  unsigned int ah = 3U;\n\
  int ai[2];\n\
  int i;\n\
  for (i = 0; i < 2; i++)\n\
    ai[i] = 8;\n\
  for (w = 1;;) {\n\
    for (; i < 5; i++)\n\
      ;\n\
    for (af = 6; af >= 0; af -= 1)\n\
      v = ai[0] ^= ad[w + 1][w][af] =\n\
          fn4(fn3(1, fn5(255U, fn2(ah, u--))), 4294967295U);\n\
    return ae;\n\
  }\n\
}\n\
int main() {\n\
  int i, j, k;\n\
  fn9();\n\
  for (i = 0; i < 7; i++)\n\
    for (j = 0; j < 5; j++)\n\
      for (k = 0; k < 7; k++)\n\
        s = s ^ ad[i][j][k];\n\
  fn1(s, 0);\n\
  return 0;\n\
}"
}
```

Please note that the JSON representation of the program code may not be directly executable code but is provided to showcase the modifications. The original structure and formatting of the program are preserved while replacing the redundant data type.
